title: Lehman Brothers: The Bank That Was Allowed to Die
description: A micro-lesson that makes Lehman Brothers: The Bank That Was Allowed to Die usable.

hook.text: On September 15, 2008, Lehman Brothers â€” 158 years old, $639 billion in assets â€” filed for bankruptcy.

buildup.text: The US government bailed out Bear Stearns in March. Markets assumed Lehman would get the same treatment.

discovery.text: Lehman's collapse triggered a chain reaction. Money markets froze. Banks stopped lending to each other.

twist.text: Hank Paulson let Lehman fail to avoid 'moral hazard.

climax.text: Lehman's failure proved that in an interconnected system, one death can trigger a pandemic.

punchline.text: The decision to let one bank die nearly killed them all.

quiz.question: What made Lehman Brothers' failure so devastating to the global economy?
options: Its interconnection with global markets caused credit to freeze worldwide in a chain reaction
